summary: The Cease Animal Research Grants Overseas Act of 2025 (CARGO Act) aims to prohibit the National Institutes of Health (NIH) from funding research projects using live animals that take place outside the United States. Citing concerns about lack of oversight and potential animal mistreatment, the bill amends the Public Health Service Act to restrict NIH support to research conducted within the U.S., encompassing the states, District of Columbia, and U.S. territories.
